Cell Motility Journal Club

Cell Motility Journal club is a weekly meeting of PMI investigators, trainees, and technical staff to discuss results from the current scientific literature. Participants vigorously discuss research related to cell motility, molecular motors, cytoskeleton, muscle biology, and advanced technologies. Many established scientists can trace their introduction to the critical analysis of scientific literature to this meeting, as it has a rich and lively history that reaches back to the 1960s. The forerunner of the journal club was called the Myo-Bio Club, and it played a role in the founding of the PMI in 1973. All members of the Penn community are invited to attend, discuss, and present! Lunch is provided.
